item.title: Javascript Notes(1) Basic Syntax
item.author: Author
item.description: Variable var vs let vs const var declarations are globally scoped or function scoped while let and const are block scoped. var variables can be updated and re-declared within its scope; let variables can be updated but not re-declared; const variables can neither be updated nor re-declared. Primitive types undefined null String Boolean Number Implicit Type Conversion “3” can be converted by 3 implicitly Strict equality === and !== Check both type and value without type conversion
